CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 2 reads: "Courier Home Fair Crowd - This is part of the opening-night crowd at The Courier Home Service Fair that turned out at Syria Mosque Tuesday night, despite heavy rain. They were delighted at the colorful booths, dazzling displays, appetizing food samples and free prizes.  This is one of the most exciting Courier Home Shows ever held in Pittsburgh, and tonight (Thursday), the final night of the fair, should bring out greater crowds than ever."
TitMainTitle: Crowd seated in Syria Mosque with Coca-Cola, Carnation Milk, and Tetley Tea booths in background, for the 1958 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair
CatSubject_tab: Trade shows--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Crowds--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Syria Mosque (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair.
